title: North Carolina Supreme Court Orders RFK Jr.’s Removal From State Ballot—After Michigan Top Court Ruled Differently
author: Siladitya Ray
description: The North Carolina ruling is a win for the former independent presidential candidate, who is now backing Trump, just hours after he was dealt a blow in Michigan.

title: Miami Police Release Tyreek Hill Body Cam Footage: Here’s What We Know
author: Molly Bohannon
description: One of the Miami-Dade police officers involved in pulling over Tyreek Hill was moved to administrative duties while the incident is investigated.

title: Nicki Minaj And Others Seemingly Call Out Jay-Z For Picking Kendrick Lamar For Super Bowl Over Lil Wayne: What To Know
author: Arianna Johnson
description: Jay-Z has been the co-producer of the Super Bowl halftime show since 2019, which means he’s a part of the team that selects the halftime performers each year.

title: Tropical Storm Francine: Hurricane Warning Issued For Louisiana As Storm Expected To Hit Cat. 2—Here’s What To Know
author: Molly Bohannon
description: Tropical Storm Francine formed in the Gulf of Mexico on Monday morning and is expected to hit Louisiana on Wednesday.

title: Republicans Try To Derail Abortion Ballot Measures Weeks Before Election
author: Alison Durkee
description: The Nebraska Supreme Court heard oral arguments Monday, while its Missouri counterpart will rule Tuesday whether to kick that state’s measure off the ballot.

title: Harris-Trump Debate: Here’s What To Expect—And How The Candidates Could Attack Each Other
author: Sara Dorn
description: ABC News is set to host the debate Tuesday at 9 p.m.

title: Harvey Weinstein Hospitalized For Emergency Heart Surgery
author: Molly Bohannon
description: The disgraced movie producer is reportedly due in court this week ahead of a retrial for alleged sex crimes.

title: Dow Rallies Almost 500 Points As September Woes Soften
author: Derek Saul
description: "The market has entered a period of directionless volatility,” remarked one strategist.

title: Apple’s AI iPhone 16: Apple Stock Slumps During Long-Awaited Event
author: Derek Saul
description: The "first iPhones designed from the ground up" for AI were introduced Monday.

title: Meta Denies Zuckerberg Told Trump He Can’t Vote For A Democrat
author: Sara Dorn
description: Zuckerberg said previously that Trump’s reaction to the shooting was “one of the most badass things I’ve ever seen in my life.”

title: The U.S. Is Getting Its First Electric Bullet Train Factory
author: Alan Ohnsman
description: Siemens plans a $60 million New York plant to supply trains for Brightline West’s high-speed line between Las Vegas and Los Angeles that can go up to 220 mph.

title: Kate Middleton Says She Completed Chemotherapy Treatment
author: Ty Roush
description: The Princess of Wales said she is in a “new phase of recovery” after revealing her cancer diagnosis earlier this year.

title: Google Facing Lawsuit Over Online Ad ‘Monopoly’ Today—Weeks After Major Court Loss: Here’s What To Know
author: Ty Roush
description: A federal judge previously ruled Google violated antitrust laws while maintaining a monopoly with its search engine.

title: Northern Lights Forecast: Here’s Where Aurora Borealis May Be Visible Tonight
author: Arianna Johnson
description: The aurora may be visible in Washington, North Dakota, South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, Maine and the northernmost parts of New York.

title: What We Know About Kamala Harris’ Policy Agenda Before Tomorrow’s Debate
author: Alison Durkee
description: The Democratic nominee's campaign updated her website to include a range of policy views ahead of Tuesday's debate.

title: Beyoncé’s ‘Cowboy Carter’ Snubbed By CMA Awards—Years After She Faced Backlash For Performance
author: Conor Murray
description: Beyoncé ventured into country music earlier this year with her chart-topping song “Texas Hold ‘Em” and album “Cowboy Carter.”

title: Harris Campaign Adds Policy Platform To Website After GOP Taunts—And Draws Contrast With ‘Trump’s Project 2025 Agenda’
author: Siladitya Ray
description: The vice president’s campaign has faced some flak from the GOP in recent weeks for not offering a detailed policy platform.

title: Trump Says He’ll Vote For Marijuana Legalization In Florida
author: Siladitya Ray
description: Trump’s support for legalizing recreational marijuana in Florida puts him at odds with GOP leaders in the state, including Gov. Ron DeSantis.

title: ‘Beetlejuice Beetlejuice’ Scores $110 Million Opening Weekend—One Of This Year’s Biggest Debuts
author: Molly Bohannon
description: “Beetlejuice Beetlejuice” debuted at the top of the box office—and saw the third best domestic opening of the year.

title: Kendrick Lamar Headlining Super Bowl Halftime Show—After Busy Year And Drake Feud
author: Molly Bohannon
description: The NFL named rapper Kendrick Lamar as the headliner for next year’s Super Bowl halftime show.

title: Boeing Reaches Major Labor Deal—Averting Costly Strike Amid Rough Year
author: Molly Bohannon
description: More than 33,000 union members were reportedly preparing to strike if Boeing didn’t come to a contract agreement.

title: Trump Vows ‘Long Term Prison Sentences’ For Election ‘Cheating’—Despite No Evidence Of Major Fraud
author: Molly Bohannon
description: Former President Donald Trump falsely said on Truth Social there was “rampant Cheating and Skullduggery” in the 2020 election at the hands of Democrats.

title: Election 2024 Swing State Polls: Harris Leading Trump Narrowly In Michigan And Wisconsin—But Tied In Pennsylvania
author: Sara Dorn
description: Harris has been gaining ground throughout battleground states in recent weeks.

title: Trump Vs. Harris 2024 Polls: Trump Takes 1-Point Lead In First Major Survey In Weeks
author: Sara Dorn
description: Most polls indicate a tight race between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.

title: Trump Continues Obsession With Crowd Size —But Reports Show Harris Draws Similar Turnouts
author: Antonio Pequeño IV
description: Trump has repeatedly claimed he has more attendees at his campaign events than Vice President Kamala Harris does, sometimes suggesting Harris’ crowd numbers are inflated or artificial, with no evidence.
